page.title: 01North of Burgess Hill
page.content: This predominantly rural area of the Sussex Weald, consists mainly of dairy farmland and deciduous woodland, about half belonging to the Heaselands Estate. Just within this area, housing development is proceding on the northern outskirts of burges Hill otherwise the land is sparsely populated. Scattered farms and private residences adjoin the four minor highways of Cuckfield Road, Bishopstone Lane, and the B.2036 and B.2028 which divide the area from north to south. small lakes, ponds and streams abound in the region and these, together with a well-maintained network of public footpaths and bridleways, permit fishing, riding and walking to be enjoyed by residents of the adjacent towns of burgess, cuckfield, and Haywards Heath. Visible evidence of urban development
